title: Print, 1753
medium: Etching and engraving on white laid paper tipped into cream laid paper
dimensions:
Sheet: 40.6 x 64.1 cm (16 in. x 25 1/4 in.)
Platemark: 40.6 x 33.3 cm (16 in. x 13 1/8 in.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Interior with throne-like chair at center. Portrait on back of chair framed by halo with flowers and sunrays; chair shaped with leaves, flanked by large escutcheons heavily decorated with plumed helmets, axes, bows and arrows, flags, musical instruments, and putti. Above chair, canopy with draping lines and foliage. All interior framed with curved molding, scenes with putti, and candles.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, 1753.
1753. Etching and engraving on white laid paper tipped into cream laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-221-7.
